| An elf-lady:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* can [see invisible creatures](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is an [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)").
* is a [lord to its kind](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD").
* is female.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* normally appears in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). |                                                                            |

- *This article is about the monster in dNetHack and notdNetHack. For the monster in *NetHack* and its female counterpart in other variants, see [elf-lord](/wiki/Elf-lord "Elf-lord").*

An **elf-lady**, @, is a type of monster that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). Elf-ladies are female counterparts to [elf-lords](/wiki/Elf-lord "Elf-lord") that have somewhat distinct traits: they possess much fewer and weaker physical attacks and lack the ability to [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"), but have the ability to cast [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") an elf-lady [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") can confer temporary [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance").

## Generation

Randomly-generated elf-ladies can appear in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). Female [Woodland-elves](/wiki/Woodland-elves "Woodland-elves"), [Green-elves](/wiki/Green-elves "Green-elves") and [Grey-elves](/wiki/Grey-elves "Grey-elves") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into elf-ladies, and elf-ladies can grow up into [Elvenqueens](/wiki/Elvenqueen_\(dNetHack\) "Elvenqueen (dNetHack)").

An elf-lady may appear in the court of a randomly-generated [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room") ruled by an [Elvenking](/wiki/Elvenking "Elvenking") or Elvenqueen.

In the [Mordor Ruins Quest](/wiki/Mordor_Ruins_Quest "Mordor Ruins Quest"), the River Ford level has a 3⁄4 chance of generating an elf-lady in the forest on the west side, and an elf-lady is among the group of elves generated on the west edge of the Elven Forest level, opposite a horde of [Mordor orcs](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc") and other monsters led by a [Nazgul](/wiki/Nazgul "Nazgul").

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Elf-lady_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Elf-lady (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ elf-lady (No tile)
Difficulty 12
Attacks Weapon 1d4 physical, Magic 0d4 mage spell
@ elf-lady (No tile)
Difficulty 12
Attacks

Weapon 1d4 physical, Magic 0d4 mage spell

Base level 9
Base experience 237
Speed 12
Base AC 6
Base MR 20
Alignment -9 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1200
Nutritional value 350
Size medium
Resistances sleep
Resistances conveyed sleep

An elf-lady:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is an elf.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is female.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • normally appears in small groups.

This article is about the monster in dNetHack and notdNetHack. For the monster in NetHack and its female counterpart in other variants, see elf-lord.

An elf-lady, @, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. Elf-ladies are female counterparts to elf-lords that have somewhat distinct traits: they possess much fewer and weaker physical attacks and lack the ability to twoweapon, but have the ability to cast monster spells.

Eating an elf-lady corpse or tin can confer temporary sleep resistance.

Generation

Randomly-generated elf-ladies can appear in small groups. Female Woodland-elves, Green-elves and Grey-elves can grow up into elf-ladies, and elf-ladies can grow up into Elvenqueens.

An elf-lady may appear in the court of a randomly-generated throne room ruled by an Elvenking or Elvenqueen.

In the Mordor Ruins Quest, the River Ford level has a 3⁄4 chance of generating an elf-lady in the forest on the west side, and an elf-lady is among the group of elves generated on the west edge of the Elven Forest level, opposite a horde of Mordor orcs and other monsters led by a Nazgul.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

An '''elf-lady''', {{magenta|@}}, is a type of monster that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. Elf-ladies are female counterparts to [[elf-lord]]s that have somewhat distinct traits: they possess much fewer and weaker physical attacks and lack the ability to [[twoweapon]], but have the ability to cast [[monster spell]]s.

[[Eating]] an elf-lady [[corpse]] or [[tin]] can confer temporary [[sleep resistance]].

==Generation==
Randomly-generated elf-ladies can appear in small [[group]]s. Female [[Woodland-elves]], [[Green-elves]] and [[Grey-elves]] can [[grow up]] into elf-ladies, and elf-ladies can grow up into [[Elvenqueen (dNetHack)|Elvenqueens]].

An elf-lady may appear in the court of a randomly-generated [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]] ruled by an [[Elvenking]] or Elvenqueen.

In the [[Mordor Ruins Quest]], the River Ford level has a {{frac|3|4}} chance of generating an elf-lady in the forest on the west side, and an elf-lady is among the group of elves generated on the west edge of the Elven Forest level, opposite a horde of [[Mordor orc]]s and other monsters led by a [[Nazgul]].
